sentences.en: A cover letter should never exceed one page; often a far shorter letter will suffice.
sentences.cn: 附信不应超过一页，通常来说，一封相对非常简短的信就足够了。

sentences.en: Drivers must not exceed a maximum of 55 miles an hour.
sentences.cn: 司机不得超过每小时五十五英里的最大时速.

sentences.en: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
sentences.cn: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

sentences.en: Give delay charge to ought to be in its are effective the amortize inside economic life, the amortize that our country sets period do not exceed 10 years.
sentences.cn: 递延费用应当在其有效经济寿命内摊销, 我国规定的摊销期不超过10年.
他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.en: In many cases, the fee structure alone will exceed the tax benefits accrued.
sentences.cn: 很多情况下，单是费用结构一项就会超过累积的税惠。

sentences.en: My value for domestic tranquillity should much exceed theirs.
sentences.cn: 我应该远比他们重视家庭的平静生活.

sentences.en: New business we'll generate should far exceed what's lost.
sentences.cn: 我们新招揽的生意会远远超过丢失的那部分.

sentences.en: Other rich pickings, including season ticket sales, are expected to exceed last year's £5m.
sentences.cn: 其他丰厚的赚头——包括季票销售额——有望超过去年的500万英镑。

sentences.en: The expenses shall not exceed 200 yuan.
The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.cn: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

sentences.en: The speed limit is 40 miles an hour. Don't exceed this maximum.
sentences.cn: 限速每小时四十英里, 不要超过这个极限.

sentences.en: What is the probability that today's demand will exceed our inventory?
sentences.cn: 今天销售量超过库存量的是概率 多少 ?

sentences.en: When you drive, you must not exceed the legal limit.
sentences.cn: 你开车时不能超过法定的速度.

sentences.en: Where payments exceed these limits they become fully taxable.
sentences.cn: 付款额超过这些限度就得全部纳税.

sentences.en: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.cn: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.en: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.cn: 每天的饮酒量不应超过两个计量单位。

trans.tran_en: to be more than a particular number or amount
to be more than a particular number or amount
